metadata.description: Mathematical and structural analysis of I Ching hexagrams

pair_analysis.insight: King Wen pairs are organized as inverse (rotation) pairs, except for 4 complement pairs involving symmetric hexagrams

transition_analysis.insight: Within pairs average 3.75 line changes; between pairs average 2.94

yang_progression.insight: Upper canon avg yang: 2.87, Lower canon avg yang: 3.12

trigram_patterns.insight: 8 pure hexagrams (same upper and lower trigram)

canon_division.insight: Upper Canon focuses on cosmic/natural principles; Lower Canon on human affairs and practical wisdom

sequence_comparison.title: Fu Xi vs King Wen Sequence Comparison
insights: Only 0 hexagrams are in the same position in both sequences
Fu Xi sequence is pure binary counting (mathematical)
King Wen sequence follows philosophical/practical organization

graph_analysis.title: Transformation Graph Analysis
insights: The graph is 6-regular: every hexagram connects to exactly 6 others
Graph diameter: 6 (max steps between any two hexagrams)
Graph is fully connected - any hexagram reachable from any other

rotation_symmetry.insight: 180° rotation partitions hexagrams into 28 pairs + 8 fixed points

complement_operation.insight: Complement operation pairs every hexagram with its "opposite"

nuclear_hexagrams.insight: 4 hexagrams are their own nuclear hexagram

transformation_groups.insight: Klein 4-group action partitions 64 hexagrams into 20 orbits
